content: The iconic character Sherlock Holmes was created by which British author in the late 19th century?

Sherlock Holmes, the renowned fictional detective, was created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, a British author in the late 19th century. Holmes first appeared in publication in 1887 in the novel "A Study in Scarlet." Over the years, Conan Doyle wrote numerous stories featuring Holmes and his assistant, Dr. John Watson, making Holmes one of the most famous and enduring characters in literature.
